titles.title: A bill to extend the deadline for commencement of construction of a hydroelectric project in the State of Alaska.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici without amendment. With written report No. 109-29.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 42.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Air Quality.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 109-681.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 411.

action.text: Mr. Otter moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 176.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/5/2006--Public Law. Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, upon licensee request, to extend the time period during which the licensee is required to commence construction of a hydroelectric project in Alaska for three consecutive two-year periods beyond the date that is four years after the license's date of issuance.
